intro: Andropogon sorghum var. yemensis, commonly known as Yemen sorghum, is a variant of sorghum native to the Arabian Peninsula, particularly Yemen. It is a tall, annual grass that typically grows in dry, arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh climates. The plant produces dense, cylindrical inflorescences composed of spikelets, which are characteristic of the grass family Poaceae.
